summary: "The Raven" is a famous poem by Edgar Allan Poe about a sad person who gets a surprise visit from a talking raven at night. The bird keeps saying "Nevermore," which upsets the person missing their loved one, Lenore. Poe wrote this poem carefully, using special rhythms and words to create a spooky and musical feel. It became very popular, making Poe well-known, and people have loved it ever since.
title: The Raven
